frameDefinitions: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.
Some Protection prevents a Danger from harming an Asset.
This frame characterizes the situation or state of affairs in which someone acts to prevent a Fire_disaster from occurring, accelerating, or affecting any area not identified as a Controlled_area.
An Agent causes a Fire to no longer burn.
A Money_owner exchanges Sum_1 in the  Source_currency for Sum_2 in the Target_currency at some Exchange_service.
A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.
frameExamples: I saw that several men in dark suits had <t>removed</t> all of the evidence from the scene.
The rubber on her sneakers <t>protected</t> her from the mud.
After checking into the Intourist-operated $30-a-day Hotel Zerafshon, we each <t>exchanged</t> $50 for Uzbek currency with a shifty loiterer in the lobby at the rate .
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Agent</fen> is the person (or other force) that causes the <fen>Theme</fen> to move.
Theme is the object that changes location.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the initial location of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before it changes location.
The non-Agentive cause of the removing event.
The time at which the removal takes place.
The location where the removal takes place.
The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The fire that Firefighters target.
The individual or group who respond(s) to the <fen>Fire</fen>.
The time when the Firefighter fights the Fire.
This role identifies the location of the Firefighters as they attempt to fight the Fire.
The individual or group that causes the <fen>Fire</fen> to no longer burn.
The combustion process that the <fen>Agent</fen> causes to end.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fire</fen> goes out.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> puts out the <fen>Fire</fen>.
The person who exchanges <fen>Sum_1</fen> for <fen>Sum_2</fen>.
An amount of money in the <fen>Source_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> exchanges for an amount in the <fen>Target_currency</fen>.
The kind of currency of the <fen>Money_owner</fen> has before the exchange.
The amount of money in the <fen>Target_currency</fen> that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives in exchange for <fen>Sum_1</fen>.
The kind of currency that the <fen>Money_owner</fen> receives as part of the exchange.
Currency that is being exchanged by the <fen>Money_owner</fen>.
The time when the currency is exchanged.
The location where the money is exchanged.
The <fen>Escapee</fen> manages to leave the <fen>Undesirable_location</fen>.
The <fex name='Undesirable_location'>Undesirable_location</fex> is where the Escapee begins.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the escaping occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Escaping occurs.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The waiter</fex> removed the dishes from the table.
The waiter removed <fex>the dishes</fex> from the table.
The waiter removed the dishes <fex>from the table</fex>.
<fex>The raging fire</fex> quickly emptied the square of all people.
<fex>That year</fex> they drained the swamp-water out of Higgs' bottomland.
You just take the dishes and rinse them <fex>in the kitchen</fex>, okay?

country that was their shield <fex>against the Soviet threat</fex>.

Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is safeguarded <fex>before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.

It took four days before <fex>the fire</fex>was extinguished.
